verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <WH5329> A Psalm <WH4210> of David. <WH1732> How long <WH5704> <WH575> wilt thou forget <WH7911> me, O LORD? <WH3068> forever? <WH5331> how long <WH5704> <WH575> wilt thou hide <WH5641> <WH853> thy face <WH6440> from <WH4480> me?

How long <WH5704> <WH575> shall I take <WH7896> counsel <WH6098> in my soul, <WH5315> having sorrow <WH3015> in my heart <WH3824> daily? <WH3119> how long <WH5704> <WH575> shall mine enemy <WH341> be exalted <WH7311> over <WH5921> me?
Consider <WH5027> and hear <WH6030> me, O LORD <WH3068> my God: <WH430> lighten <WH215> mine eyes, <WH5869> lest <WH6435> I sleep <WH3462> the sleep of death; <WH4194>
Lest <WH6435> mine enemy <WH341> say, <WH559> I have prevailed against <WH3201> him; and those that trouble <WH6862> me rejoice <WH1523> when <WH3588> I am moved. <WH4131>
But I <WH589> have trusted <WH982> in thy mercy; <WH2617> my heart <WH3820> shall rejoice <WH1523> in thy salvation. <WH3444>
I will sing <WH7891> unto the LORD, <WH3068> because <WH3588> he hath dealt bountifully <WH1580> with <WH5921> me.
